contents: The first popularly known Senate filibuster occurred in 1841. (4) <u>Senator Henry Clay, who was from the majority Whig Party and favored war with Britain in 1812, supported a bank bill that was likely to pass.</u> Senators from the minority Democratic Party opposed it and started a filibuster to prevent a vote. Clay attempted to change Senate rules to eliminate filibusters, but a lack of support prevented the change. (5) <u>The Democrat’s filibuster</u> lasted almost a month.
